headline: United Airlines’ 2025 Results Soar Past Expectations
summary: United Airlines’ fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results soared past Wall Street’s expectations.  The carrier reported fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of $3.10 a share on revenue of $15.4 billion, up 4.8% and the highest quarterly revenue in United history, beating expectations.  Revenue of $59.07 billion, up 3.5% and the highest in United’s history, was slightly above the $59.05 billion expected.

headline: United stock rises after beats on Q4 earnings and guidance, sees strong 'revenue momentum' in 2026
summary: United Airlines reported a fourth quarter earnings beat after the bell on Tuesday, a week after rival Delta saw premium and business travelers boost its results.

headline: Did GE's (GE) Engine Overhaul and Delta GEnx Deal Just Recast Its Aviation Investment Narrative?
summary: In recent weeks, GE Aerospace has announced leadership changes consolidating its commercial engines and services operations under Mohamed Ali, secured a major GEnx engine and long-term services agreement with Delta Air Lines for Boeing 787-10 aircraft, and continued to feature prominently in industry conferences and earnings-season commentary. These developments highlight how GE Aerospace is tightening operational control across the engine lifecycle while deepening customer relationships,...

headline: United Airlines Reports Earnings Tuesday. What Airline Stocks Need to Fly Higher.
summary: United Airlines reports earnings after the close Tuesday and investors will be hoping it can boost the sector’s stock after disappointing guidance from its rival Delta last week.  Wall Street is expecting  United  to post earnings per share of $2.93 on revenue of $15.4 billion.  As with  Delta  the airline’s forward guidance may prove to be more important.

headline: Why brands are courting consumers with premium experiences
summary: The premiumization of services and goods is no longer a tactic dominated by airlines. As consumers worry about a recession, brands are looking to the wealthy to keep spending.

headline: 5 Must-Read Analyst Questions From Delta’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Delta’s fourth quarter results were met with negative market reaction, as margin compression and stagnant main cabin demand weighed on investor sentiment despite headline revenue and profit exceeding Wall Street expectations. Management pointed to robust performance in premium cabins, continued loyalty program strength, and record cash sales as key drivers, but acknowledged nonfuel costs rose due to weather disruptions and a government shutdown. headline: 3 Profitable Stocks That Concern Us
summary: Even if a company is profitable, it doesn’t always mean it’s a great investment. Some struggle to maintain growth, face looming threats, or fail to reinvest wisely, limiting their future potential.
